1.sentence: Engram had 4 receptions for 44 yards in his NFL debut.
Engram had 4 receptions for 44 yards in his NFL debut.

1.comment: Engram had 4 receptions for 44 yards in his NFL debut. His production should increase going forward.    The Giants predictably couldn't run the ball, thanks again to their offensive line.

The rookie tight end was second on the receiving list with 6 grabs for 62 yards.

2.comment: Engram will have to continue to step up. The rookie tight end was second on the receiving list with 6 grabs for 62 yards. This includes a great, diving reception he made on a late third down. Meanwhile,

3.comment: Engram primarily, and it paid off. Engram caught 5 of his 7 targets for 82 yards and a touchdown. No other Giant saw more than 3 targets, and besides Engram, no New York player logged more than 15 receiving yards.    Siemian, meanwhile, generated 376 passing yards, but that was a very misleading figure. Much of that came in garbage time. 4.comment: Engram. The rookie tight end saw a team-leading 12 targets and caught 6 of them for 60 yards and a touchdown. Engram showed explosive ability and had a long play called back because he stepped out of bounds before touching the ball. He has the potential to become a matchup nightmare, and he can be trusted as a low-end TE1 with upside for the rest of the season. Elsewhere,

5.comment: Engram (4-70) and King (3-33) both caught touchdowns. Engram's score came in meaningless action, but I'm sure his fantasy owners won't complain.

2.sentence: A few minutes later, the 49ers put the game away with Matt Breida (9-55-1) running up the middle untouched for a 33-yard touchdown as Landon Collins took a bad angle to let Breida cut upfield for pay dirt.

3.sentence: Beathard completed 19-of-25 passes for 288 yards with 2 touchdowns and 1 interception.

6.comment: Engram. The Giants' defense continued to struggle with tight ends and allowed a score to a tight end for the 10th-straight game. Beathard hit Garrett Celek (4-67-1) on the run, and he broke a tackle from Janoris Jenkins to get into end zone for a 47-yard score. That gave the 49ers a 17-13 lead at the half. In the third quarter, the Giants had a drive end with a missed 34-yard field goal. The 49ers soon moved inside the 30-yard line, but Olivier Vernon intercepted a screen pass to snatch the scoring opportunity away. San Francisco got the ball back and continued to move the chains on New York. On the first play of the fourth quarter, Beathard kept a bootleg to run into the end zone for an 11-yard touchdown. A few minutes later, the 49ers put the game away with Matt Breida (9-55-1) running up the middle untouched for a 33-yard touchdown as Landon Collins took a bad angle to let Breida cut upfield for pay dirt.    Beathard completed 19-of-25 passes for 288 yards with 2 touchdowns and 1 interception.    Carlos Hyde led the 49ers on the ground with 17 carries for 98 yards.    Manning was 28-of-37 for 273 yards and 2 touchdowns. Shepard caught 11 passes for 142 yards. Engram hauled in 6 passes for 31 yards and a touchdown.
